author: Mansi Agarwal
content: IndiGo Co-founder Rakesh Gangwal has invested $20 million (around ₹165 crore) in B2B manufacturing services startup Zetwerk through Wheelhouse Venture Capital. In 2021, the startup raised $150 million from Lightspeed, Sequoia and others at a $1.3 billion valuation to become a unicorn. Zetwerk currently has a valuation of $2.8 billion, Moneycontrol reported.
title: IndiGo Co-founder Gangwal invests ₹165 cr in B2B unicorn Zetwerk

author: Daisy Mowke
content: The Union Cabinet on Thursday approved the IndiaAI mission with an outlay of ₹10,371.92 crore for five years. The mission aims to establish a comprehensive ecosystem catalysing AI innovation through strategic programmes and partnerships across the public and private sectors. It will be implemented by 'IndiaAI' Independent Business Division under Digital India Corporation.
title: ₹10,372-crore IndiaAI mission approved by govt

author: Vivek
content: Social media startup Hunch has raised $23 million in a Series A funding round led by US-based Alpha Wave and South Korea-based Hashed Emergent. The startup, which launched its app in December 2022, allows users to engage in conversations and participate in polls anonymously, catering to a wide range of interests from politics to relationship advice.
title: Social media startup Hunch raises $23 million in a Series A round

author: Vivek
content: Saudi Arabia-based construction technology startup BRKZ has raised $8 million in a Series A funding round led by 9900 and BECO Capital, with contributions from Aramco's Wa'ed Ventures, Knollwood Investment Advisory, RZM Investment, and MISY Ventures. Founded in 2022 by Ibrahim Manna, BRKZ leverages technology to streamline procurement processes.
title: BRKZ raises $8M to expand construction tech solutions

author: Vivek
content: Hack2Skill, a community platform dedicated to hackathons, has raised $1 million in a combined debt and equity financing round. The round was co-led by Recur Club and String Ventures. Founded in 2021 by Samkit Sharma, The startup aims revolutionize the way communities and corporations manage hackathons.
title: Community startup Hack2Skill raises $1 million in debt and equity

author: Pratham Nagpal
content: Pune-based jewelry startup Palmonas has roped in Bollywood actor Shraddha Kapoor as its new cofounder. With this partnership, Palmonas looks to leverage Kapoor’s popularity to expand its reach, the company said in a statement on Thursday. Inc42’s data reveals that over 19 celebrities from the entertainment industry-backed a total of 26 startups last year.
title: Jewellery startup Palmonas ropes in Shraddha Kapoor as Cofounder

author: Deepika Bhatt
content: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das has said that RBI is and remains fully supportive of Fintech companies. "One may own and drive a Ferrari but still one has to obey the traffic rules to avoid accidents," he said. The RBI has barred Paytm Payments Bank Ltd (PPBL) from accepting deposits, credit transactions or top-ups in any customer accounts after March 15.
title: You may have Ferrari, but still have to obey traffic rules: RBI Guv Das on Paytm

author: Mansi Agarwal
content: Elon Musk shared an edited picture of OpenAI CEO Sam Altman wearing an ID card that read 'ClosedAI', with a caption saying, "Fixed it". Musk recently sued OpenAI, accusing it of breaching its founding contract by pursuing profits. In another post, Musk said he will drop the lawsuit if OpenAI changes its name to ClosedAI.
title: Musk shares altered pic of Sam Altman with ID saying 'ClosedAI'

author: Purushottam
content: Google & Indian app developers have agreed to pause their dispute over Google's billing policy for 4 months. Shaadi was among the affected apps, but after intervention from Indian government officials, most delisted apps, including Shaadi.com, were reinstated. Anupam Mittal, CEO of People Group, thanked union ministers for their help and emphasized the importance of finding a fair solution.
title: Google Pauses Indian Apps Billing Dispute for 4 Months

author: Pratham Nagpal
content: BharatPe’s former MD and cofounder Ashneer Grover has reportedly written to the RBI requesting an investigation into the shareholding of the fintech unicorn. Grover said in the letter addressed to RBI governor Shaktikanta Das, dated March 6, that BharatPe has deliberately “defrauded” the regulator by bringing back Bhavik Koladiya to the company’s cap table, after securing a few licenses.
title: Ashneer Grover seeks RBI probe into BharatPe's shareholding
